text: ਦਿਨ ਤੇ ਪਹਰ ਪਹਰ ਤੇ ਘਰੀਆਂ ਆਵ ਘਟੈ ਤਨੁ ਛੀਜੈ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Day by day, hour by hour, life runs its course, and the body withers away.

transliteration.text: din tē pahar pahar tē gharīānh āv ghatai tan shījai .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਕਾਲੁ ਅਹੇਰੀ ਫਿਰੈ ਬਧਿਕ ਜਿਉ ਕਹਹੁ ਕਵਨ ਬਿਧਿ ਕੀਜੈ ॥੧॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Death, like a hunter, a butcher, is on the prowl; tell me, what can we do? ||1||

transliteration.text: kāl ahērī phirai badhik jiu kahah kavan bidh kījai .1.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਮਾਤ ਪਿਤਾ ਭਾਈ ਸੁਤ ਬਨਿਤਾ ਕਹਹੁ ਕੋਊ ਹੈ ਕਾ ਕਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mother, father, siblings, children and spouse - tell me, who belongs to whom? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: māt pitā bhāī sut banitā kahah kōū hai kā kā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Kabir

text: ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਜੋਤਿ ਕਾਇਆ ਮਹਿ ਬਰਤੈ ਆਪਾ ਪਸੂ ਨ ਬੂਝੈ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As long as the light remains in the body, the beast does not understand himself.

transliteration.text: jab lag jōt kāiā mah baratai āpā pasū n būjhai .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

text: ਲਾਲਚ ਕਰੈ ਜੀਵਨ ਪਦ ਕਾਰਨ ਲੋਚਨ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਸੂਝੈ ॥੨॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He acts in greed to maintain his life and status, and sees nothing with his eyes. ||2||

transliteration.text: lālach karai jīvan pad kāran lōchan kashū n sūjhai .2.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

text: ਕਹਤ ਕਬੀਰ ਸੁਨਹੁ ਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਾਨੀ ਛੋਡਹੁ ਮਨ ਕੇ ਭਰਮਾ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, listen, O mortal: Renounce the doubts of your mind.

transliteration.text: kahat kabīr sunah rē prānī shōdah man kē bharamā .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

text: ਕੇਵਲ ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪਹੁ ਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਾਨੀ ਪਰਹੁ ਏਕ ਕੀ ਸਰਨਾਂ ॥੩॥੨॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Chant only the One Naam, the Name of the Lord, O mortal, and seek the Sanctuary of the One Lord. ||3||2||

transliteration.text: kēval nām japah rē prānī parah ēk kī saranānh .3.2.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.
